body:
### Read problems statements in [Mandarin Chinese](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/COOK132/mandarin/CONSSTR.pdf), [Russian](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/COOK132/russian/CONSSTR.pdf), and [Bengali](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/COOK132/bengali/CONSSTR.pdf) as well. Consider a string $s$. The following operation can be performed on it successively several (possibly zero) times. - Select any non empty suffix of $s$ and append it to $s$ For example, if $s = \text{abcd}$, then $s$ can become either $\text{abcdd}$, $\text{abcdcd}$, $\text{abcdbcd}$ or $\text{abcdabcd}$ after one operation. Successive operations are now performed on the new string. You are given a string $t$, the resultant string after applying several (possibly zero) operations on some string. You must find any such string $s$ of the **shortest** length from which $t$ can be obtained after some sequence of operations. It can be proven that such a string always exists.
All submissions for this problem are available.

problemComponents.constraints:
- $1 \leq T \leq 100$
- $1 \le |t| \le 2 \cdot 10^5$
- String $t$ contains only lowercase english alphabets.
- The total length of all the strings in the input is at most $2 \cdot 10^5$.
problemComponents.statement:
### Read problems statements in [Mandarin Chinese](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/COOK132/mandarin/CONSSTR.pdf), [Russian](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/COOK132/russian/CONSSTR.pdf), and [Bengali](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/COOK132/bengali/CONSSTR.pdf) as well.

Consider a string $s$. The following operation can be performed on it successively several (possibly zero) times. 

- Select any non empty suffix of $s$ and append it to $s$

For example, if $s = \text{abcd}$, then $s$ can become either $\text{abcdd}$, $\text{abcdcd}$, $\text{abcdbcd}$ or $\text{abcdabcd}$ after one operation. Successive operations are now performed on the new string.

You are given a string $t$, the resultant string after applying several (possibly zero) operations on some string. You must find any such string $s$ of the **shortest** length from which $t$ can be obtained after some sequence of operations. It can be proven that such a string always exists.
problemComponents.inputFormat:
- The first line contains one number $T$, the number of test cases.

- The only line of each test case contains the string $t$.
problemComponents.outputFormat: For each test case print a string $s$ of the shortest possible length which satisfies the requirements. If there are multiple such strings, you may print any.

sampleTestCases.explanation:
**Test case $1$:** String $\text{ab}$ satisfies the requirements.

$\text{ab}$ $\rightarrow$ $\text{abb}$ $\rightarrow$ $\text{abbabb}$ $\rightarrow$ $\text{abbabbbabb}$

No string of length less than $2$ exists from which $\text{abbabbbabb}$ can be obtained after some operations.

**Test case $2$:** String $\text{ab}$ satisfies the requirements.

$\text{ab}$ $\rightarrow$ $\text{abb}$ $\rightarrow$ $\text{abbb}$ $\rightarrow$ $\text{abbbabbb}$ $\rightarrow$ $\text{abbbabbbb}$

**Test case $3$:** String $\text{codechef}$ satisfies the requirements.

$\text{codechef}$ $\rightarrow$ $\text{codechefchef}$ $\rightarrow$ $\text{codechefcheff}$

languages_supported: CPP14, C, JAVA, PYTH 3.6, CPP17, PYTH, PYP3, CS2, ADA, PYPY, TEXT, PAS fpc, NODEJS, RUBY, PHP, GO, HASK, TCL, PERL, SCALA, LUA, kotlin, BASH, JS, LISP sbcl, rust, PAS gpc, BF, CLOJ, R, D, CAML, FORT, ASM, swift, FS, WSPC, LISP clisp, SQL, SCM guile, PERL6, ERL, CLPS, ICK, NICE, PRLG, ICON, COB, SCM chicken, PIKE, SCM qobi, ST, SQLQ, NEM
problem_author_html_handle: 7★um_nik
